sentence.Network_en: Beauty is an attitude. It has nothing to do with age.
sentence.Network_cn: 美是一种态度，与年龄无关。

sentence.Network_en: When life gets hard and you want to give up, remember that life is full of ups and downs, and without the downs, the ups would mean nothing.
sentence.Network_cn: 当生活很艰难，你想要放弃的时候，请记住，生活充满了起起落落，如果没有低谷，那站在高处也失去了意义。

sentence.Network_en: I know it's nothing serious and I feel quite unemotional about it.
sentence.Network_cn: 我知道那根本没什么大不了的，所以有些无动于衷。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)(concluding a list of negatives) nothing at all
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（用在一连串否定的最后）什么也没有

lj.lj_ly: how could you solve it with no clues, no witnesses, no nothing?.
lj.lj_ls: 没有线索，没有证人，什么都没有，这案子你怎么能破得了？。

lj.lj_ly: not for nothing have I a brother-in-law who cooks professionally.
lj.lj_ls: 我有个厨艺一流的姐夫是很有好处的。

lj.lj_ly: nothing but the best will do.
nothing but the best will do.

jx.jx_en_mean: there is no prospect of success or agreement

lj.lj_ly: He wants to marry her. Nothing doing!.
there's nothing doing, and I've been waiting for weeks.
lj.lj_ls: 什么事情都没发生，而我却等了好几个星期。

lj.lj_ly: there was &B{nothing for it but to} follow.

jx.jx_en_mean: used to emphasize how extreme something is
jx.jx_cn_mean: 不折不扣是，十足是；完全是

lj.lj_ly: it was nothing less than sexual harassment.

jx.jx_en_mean: not a great amount; nothing of importance
jx.jx_cn_mean: 数量不多；没什么重要的

means.word_mean: 不重要,琐碎,无价值,无意义
无,没有人,没有任何东西

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English nān thing (see no, thing)

encyclopedia.content: 歌手简介 主唱Danny O’Donoghue 吉他手Mark Sheehan 鼓手Glen Power 爱尔兰摇滚近年声势比较微弱，U2推出录音室专辑已是三年多前的事，TheCranberries也早于四年前解散，SineadO'connor则把音乐转向了静谧的神学，老一辈的音乐人似乎都在休养生息当中。不过最近几个月一支来自都柏林的新鲜血液———TheScript重新夺回了大家对爱尔兰摇滚的关注。The Script是一支三人摇滚乐队，成员包括主唱Danny O’Donoghue、光头吉他手Mark S

entry.tran: 没有什么;没有一件(东西);没有一点
entry.def: Nothing means not a single thing, or not a single part of something.

example.ex: I've done nothing much since coffee time...
example.tran: 咖啡时间过后，我什么都没干。

example.ex: Mr Pearson said he knew nothing of his wife's daytime habits...
example.tran: 皮尔逊先生说，他对妻子白天的生活习惯一无所知。

entry.tran: 无关紧要的事物(或人);微不足道的事物(或人)
entry.def: You use nothing to indicate that something or someone is not important or significant.

example.ex: Because he had always had money it meant nothing to him...
example.tran: 因为他一直不缺钱，所以这对他来说不算什么。

example.ex: While the increase in homicides is alarming, it is nothing compared to what is to come in the rest of the decade...
example.tran: 虽然凶杀案的增加令人担忧，但和这个十年里接下来的几年将要发生的事相比却是小巫见大巫了。

entry.tran: 极低的价格;相当于免费
entry.def: If you say that something cost nothing or is worth nothing, you are indicating that it cost or is worth a surprisingly small amount of money.

example.ex: The furniture was threadbare; he'd obviously picked it up for nothing...
example.tran: 这件家具很破旧，显然他是白捡来的了。

example.ex: Homes in this corner of Mantua that once went for $350,000 are now worth nothing.
example.tran: 曼图亚市这个位置的房子曾一度卖到35万美元，现在不值几个钱了。

entry.tran: (用于形容词或带 to 的不定式前表示事物或人不具备所说的性质)没有什么，不是什么
entry.def: You use nothing before an adjective or 'to'-infinitive to say that something or someone does not have the quality indicated.

example.ex: Around the lake the countryside generally is nothing special...
example.tran: 湖四周的乡村总的来说没有什么特别的。

example.ex: There was nothing remarkable about him...
example.tran: 他没有什么特别之处。

entry.tran: (用于 so + 形容词、副词前或比较级前表示强调)没有别的东西，没有别的事情
entry.def: You can use nothing before 'so' and an adjective or adverb, or before a comparative, to emphasize how strong or great a particular quality is.

example.ex: Youngsters learn nothing so fast as how to beat the system...
example.tran: 年轻人对如何钻制度的空子学得最快。

example.ex: I consider nothing more important in my life than songwriting...
example.tran: 我想我的生活中没什么比写歌更重要了。

entry.tran: 要么彻底干完，要么根本不干
entry.def: You can use all or nothing to say that either something must be done fully and completely or else it cannot be done at all.

example.ex: Either he went through with this thing or he did not; it was all or nothing.
example.tran: 他要么把这件事做完，要么就不做，只有这两种选择。

entry.def: If you say that something is better than nothing, you mean that it is not what is required, but that it is better to have that thing than to have nothing at all.

example.ex: After all, 15 minutes of exercise is better than nothing.
example.tran: 毕竟，锻炼15分钟比不锻炼好。

entry.tran: (用于名词、不带 to 的不定式或 -ing 形式前)只有，仅仅
entry.def: You use nothing but in front of a noun, an infinitive without 'to', or an '-ing' form to mean 'only'.

example.ex: All that money brought nothing but sadness and misery and tragedy...
example.tran: 钱带来的只是悲伤、痛苦和灾难。

example.ex: It did nothing but make us ridiculous...
example.tran: 这只是让我们显得很滑稽。

entry.def: You can say 'Nothing doing' when you want to say that something is not happening or cannot be done.

example.ex: Pay now, or nothing doing...
example.tran: 现在付钱，否则不行。

example.ex: 'I could take the subway and have David pick me up at the station.' — 'Nothing doing.'
example.tran: “我可以坐地铁，然后让戴维到车站接我。”——“不行。”

entry.def: If you say that there is nothing for it but to take a particular action, you mean that it is the only possible course of action that you can take, even though it might be unpleasant.

example.ex: Much depends on which individual ingredients you choose. There is nothing for it but to taste and to experiment for yourself...
example.tran: 很大程度上取决于你选择哪种配料。除了亲口品尝和动手尝试外，没有别的方法。

example.ex: He wished he was not in a room so far from the bathroom. There was nothing for it but a long trudge through the house.
example.tran: 他真希望自己的房间离卫生间不那么远，没别的办法，只能走上长长的一段穿过屋子。

entry.def: You use nothing if not in front of an adjective to indicate that someone or something clearly has a lot of the particular quality mentioned.

example.ex: Professor Fish has been nothing if not professional...
example.tran: 菲什教授一贯表现出很高的职业水准。

example.ex: Hollywood is nothing if not creative, especially if someone else will pick up the bills.
example.tran: 好莱坞是极有创造力的地方，尤其是如果有人肯埋单的话。

entry.def: People sometimes say 'It's nothing' as a polite response after someone has thanked them for something they have done.

example.ex: 'Thank you for the wonderful dinner.' — 'It's nothing,' Sarah said...
example.tran: “谢谢你招待了这么美味的晚餐。”——“这没什么，”萨拉说。

example.ex: 'I'll be on my way. I can't thank you enough, Alan.' — 'It was nothing, but take care.'
example.tran: “艾伦，我要走了。真不知该怎么感谢你。”——“小事情，多保重。”

entry.def: If you say about a story or report that there is nothing in it or nothing to it, you mean that it is untrue.

example.ex: It's all rubbish and superstition, and there's nothing in it.
example.tran: 这都是废话和迷信，不是真的。

entry.def: If you say about an activity that there is nothing to it or nothing in it, you mean that it is extremely easy.

example.ex: This device has a gripper that electrically twists off the jar top. Nothing to it...
example.tran: 这个装置有一个能拧开瓶盖的电动钳子，并不复杂。

example.ex: If you've shied away from making pancakes in the past, don't be put off — there's really nothing in it!
example.tran: 如果你过去不敢做烤薄饼的话，现在别迟疑了，真是一点儿都不费事!

entry.tran: (比赛或竞争中)水平不相上下，势均力敌
entry.def: If you say about a contest or competition that there is nothing in it, you mean that two or more of the competitors are level and have an equal chance of winning.

entry.tran: (用于强调，表示事情让人吃惊或重要)简直，全然
entry.def: You can use nothing less than to emphasize your next words, often indicating that something seems very surprising or important.

example.ex: What he had in mind amounted to nothing less than a total reversal of the traditional role of the executive...
example.tran: 他头脑中所想的简直就是对管理人员传统角色的彻底颠覆。

example.ex: You're nothing less than a murderer!
example.tran: 你简直就是凶手！

entry.tran: 并非没有道理;事出有因
entry.def: If you say that it was not for nothing that something happened, you are emphasizing that there was a very good reason for it to happen.

example.ex: Not for nothing was the plane called 'The widow-maker'...
example.tran: 这种飞机被称作“寡妇机”是事出有因的。

example.ex: It's not for nothing that interior decorators the world over look to the English country garden for glorious inspiration.
example.tran: 全世界的室内设计师都希望从英国乡村花园汲取美妙的灵感，这并非没有道理。

entry.tran: 不付代价的收益;不劳而获
entry.def: If you say that someone is getting something for nothing, you disapprove of the fact that they are getting what they want without doing or giving anything in return.

example.ex: What's wrong with you is that you think you can get something for nothing.
example.tran: 你的问题是你认为自己可以不劳而获。

entry.def: Nothing of the sort is used when strongly contradicting something that has just been said.

example.ex: 'We're going to talk this over in my office.'—'We're going to do nothing of the sort.'...
example.tran: “我们打算到我办公室把这件事谈个明白。”——“我们决不同意这么做。”

example.ex: Mrs Adamson said that she was extremely sorry, in tones that made it clear that she was nothing of the sort.
example.tran: 亚当森夫人说她深感抱歉，但她的语气清楚地让人感到她毫无歉意。

sentences.sentence: "it looked like nothing I had ever seen before"
"reduced to nil all the work we had done"
"we racked up a pathetic goose egg"

means.word_mean: 1. in no way; to no degree;

list.explanation: 毫无成功或获胜的希塑

example.en: l know they are on a hiding to nothing.
example.zh: 我知道他们丝毫没有获胜的希望。

list.explanation: 什么也不懂，信息不灵，得到错误情报

example.en: Tom doesn't know from nothing. He is really dense!
example.zh: 汤姆啥也不懂，真是笨透了!

list.explanation: 微不足道，引不起兴趣，不令人兴奋，不十分好

example.en: I got a little bit of a raise this year，but it was nothing to write home about.
example.zh: 今年我得到一点提升，但并不值得一提。

example.en: His pitch was nothing to write home about.

auth_sentence.content: There was nothing there that was new at all.
auth_sentence.res_content: There was nothing there that was new at all.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There was nothing there that was new at all.

auth_sentence.res_content: Despite his doubts he has nothing to worry about.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Despite his doubts he has nothing to worry about.

auth_sentence.content: There's been nothing we could do about it.
auth_sentence.res_content: There's been nothing we could do about it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There's been nothing we could do about it.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 其变体n用在元音前面,表示"不,非"

stems_affixes.word_buile: no不,非+one一→没有一个→没有人,没有任何东西
no不,非+where什么地方, 在哪里→adv.无处, 到处都无
no不,非+one一→没有一个→没有人,没有任何东西

Sentence.sentence: The man is making a fuss about nothing.

Andrew Heidrich, an education network administrator from Sacramento, plays World of Warcraft for about two to four hours every other night, but that's nothing compared with the 40 to 60 hours a week he spent playing online games when he was in college.
LOL has evolved into something much subtler and sophisticated and is used even when nothing is remotely amusing.
But in the world of the application essay, it's nothing.
In to day's personality stakes, nothing is more highly valued than the sense of humor.

means.word_mean: 没有东西, 没有事情, 没有一点儿

sentences.en: Nothing in the world is difficult for one who sets his mind into it.
sentences.cn: 天下无难事, 只怕有心人。

sentences.en: There is nothing in this box, it's empty.
sentences.cn: 这盒子里没有任何东西, 是空的。

sentences.en: I had nothing stronger than orange juice to drink.
sentences.cn: 我只喝了橙汁, 没喝酒。

sentences.en: There is nothing wrong with the machine.
I know nothing about the accident.
sentences.cn: 对那次事故我什么也不知道。

sentences.en: There's nothing that you can do to help.
She is an interesting person but her husband is a real nothing.
sentences.cn: 她是个十分有趣的人, 但她的丈夫真就不及她了。

sentences.en: I feel what a nothing I am!
sentences.cn: 我感到我是多么渺小啊！
